fields.description:
It's very annoying with the User Picker if we need to select users in multiple groups. 
We can not do at once because every time we select a new group then Filter, the previously selected users
are cleared. 

Please fix this.
fields.summary: Possibility to select multiple users from multiple groups in one pass when using User Picker

fields.description: According to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Deleting+a+user+account, removing a user from all groups should in turn remove them from all user pickers.  We haven't seen this work in practice though, and end up just prepending their name with "ZZ - " to ensure they get bumped to the end of the user picker lists.
fields.summary: Removing users from all groups does not remove them from user pickers

fields.description:
We need to document the subtleties of when you can go without specifying the reporter attribute of the CreateIssue tag, and when it becomes mandatory. It is related to the Modify Reporter privilege. See JRA-12984 for a description of the underlying issue.

I'll update the doco.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Jelly doco for Create Issue tag says that default value of reporter tag is the current logged in user. But it ain't that simple.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12984].
  {panel}

A Jelly CreateIssue without specifying the reporter fails, if the user has Modify Reporter privilege.

For example:
{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:CreateIssue project-key="TP" summary="Please help me" assignee="idaniel"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

The above Jelly script fails with the following error message:
{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=Please help me)(issuetype=3)(project-key=TP)(priority=3)(assignee=idaniel)(pid=10000))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=idaniel</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>
Result=input
Error for field "reporter" : Reporter is required.
</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

It succeeds if the user does not have Modify Reporter privilege.

Anton explained to me that this is because, if the user does not have Modify Reporter privilege, the only reporter that it makes sense to use if one is not specified is the logged in user. So it does that. 

However, if Modify Reporter privilege is set, there are two options:
1. the current logged in user
2. an anonymous reporter

JIRA currently doesn't have the means of distinguishing between the two, so we fail with an error message.

Can we please improve this? For example, could we not have an extra attribute on the CreateIssue tag that indicated specifically that we wanted an anonymous reporter?

In the meantime, the [documentation|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#CreateIssue] needs improving as all it says it that the default value for reporter is the currently logged in user. I will create a separate issue for this documentation task.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: CreateIssue without specifying reporter fails if the user has Modify Reporter privilege. This could be done better.

fields.description:
A CreateIssue in a Jelly script with an invalid or missing project key fails, but with a not particularly useful error message.

Here is the Jelly script:

{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="It is broken" assignee="idaniel" reporter="idaniel"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

It fails with the following message:

{code}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira='jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib'>
  <Error action='CreateIssueDetails'>
    <TagContents>(CreateIssue(summary=It is broken)(reporter=idaniel)(project-key=ABC)(assignee=idaniel))</TagContents>
    <ExecutedAs>user=idaniel</ExecutedAs>
    <ErrorMessage>Tag CreateIssue requires (jelly.username, jelly.project.id) variables to be set in the Context</ErrorMessage>
  </Error>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

I get the same error message if I create it without a project-key attribute, or with project-key="".

Any chance of a more meaningful message, for example, you must specify project-key, or project-key is not for an existing project?

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Jelly CreateIssue tag with invalid project-key attribute fails, but with a not very useful error message

fields.description:
We are a german company starting to use Jira as a customer helpdesk.
We need to have Projects to be used by our english speaking customers at the same time as our german speaking ones.
So there are many objects in Jira that can't be translated such as "priorities" or "security leveles".
We identified this objects with the Problem:
* Components
* Custom Fields
* Project Categories
* Projects
* Security Levels
* Transitions
For the moment we help ourselves by entering the german and the english phrase at the same time.

Could you help us please.
fields.summary: Projects in two differnent Languages

fields.description:
I'm simply looking at my In Progress issues filter on that page and I get the problem.  

I'm providing the attachment screenshot that I cut down slightly to protect the innocents.
fields.summary: View button on IssueNavigator.jspa sometimes is displayed across the entire screen.

fields.description: CVS version of SVN-100
fields.summary: Retain CVS information even if issue key changes
Sub-task icon background is not transparent

fields.description:
I was looking through the source code for com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractMessageHandler when looking into a customer's problem of duplicate users being created when creating issues from email with createusers=true

In AbstractMessageHandler there is no immediate evidence in getAuthorFromSender() or in the methods it calls, findUserByEmail() or findUserByUsername(),  that either the strings from the database or from the incoming email are being trimmed.

Thus, if there are blank characters around the email address from the database or from the email, then perhaps we are failing to find an existing user.

I must confess that I have not chased this further into the lower level methods in other source code repositories other than the JIRA code, that is, in the following methods:
- com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getSenders()
- com.atlassian.core.user.UserUtils.getUser()
- com.opensymphony.user.User.getEmail()

Please note that this is not necessarily the problem that my support customer is having. I have not yet proved that the customer has extra spaces in the database or email addresses, etc. I'm just raising a potential issue in the code, or an area where the code might perhaps be improved.

Please forgive me if I am off the mark here and the strings are being trimmed somewhere where I have not looked.

Nor have I established whether it is even possible to store blank characters around email addresses in the database, or extract blank characters around email addresses in the email.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: AbstractMessageHandler might not be removing spaces from email addresses before using them to determine if a user exists when creating an issue from an email

fields.description: Is it possible to make the comment field mandatory? I have certain transitions that has no fields required to enter except for comments, but I understand that is is optional by default.
fields.summary: Allow comment fields to be mandatory (required)
Sorting by work-ratio breaks if no issues have an original estimate

Currently the com.atlassian.velocity.VelocityHelper is the only class that has been identified to use a sun.* class.

See: https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/bamboo/download/COV-FUNCHEAD/artifacts/build-11/Clover/com/atlassian/jira/mail/MailingListCompiler.html

fields.description:
If a user has installed JIRA using the executable, the JIRA Windows service name is JIRA and a time stamp.   The directions need to tell the user to look for the service name in the services control panel by right-clicking and choosing Properties.  

   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Increasing+JIRA+memory


For example:

tomcat5 //US//JIRA --JvmMs 256 --JvmMx 256

becomes

tomcat5 //US//JIRA<timestamp value> --JvmMs 256 --JvmMx 256
fields.summary: Instructions for increasing memory need to reflect new service name nomenclature

fields.description:
I've just tried to install JIRA on Max OS X and I encountered a permissions problem when trying to run startup.sh. I received the error message "Permission Denied".

It turns out that the solution was to change the permissions by running the following command within Mac's Terminal from JIRA's bin directory (/jira/bin/):

chmod +x *.sh

I believe this changes the permissions required for startup.sh and catalina.sh and perhaps other files too.

We should change the permissions by default if possible, or find another way of making installing JIRA Standalone on a Mac or Unix machine far easier. We could at least document the work around as an additional step in JIRA's docs if nothing else.

I am not sure if a bug was raised from JSP-9626 where I found the solution to this issue.

I found some really elaborate fixes to this problem in our Forums when Googling that our poor uses were going through. I've posted the work around to the post but have a look at this solution to understand the problems this is causing:

 http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257241034
fields.summary: Installing JIRA Standalone on Mac OS X / Unix is seriously flawed due to permissions problem

fields.description:
When you run JIRA as a service with JAVA_HOME set to JDK 1.5 x64 the service stops with the following error:
{noformat}
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [info] Running Service...
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [info] Starting service...
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [173  javajni.c] [error] %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [924  prunsrv.c] [error] Failed creating java C:\Java\jdk1.5.0_08\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [1179 prunsrv.c] [error] ServiceStart returned 1
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [info] Run service finished.
[2007-06-25 11:32:06] [info] Procrun finished.
{noformat}

work around this issue is to use JDK 1.5 i386 edition
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't run as a Windows service with JDK x64 edition

Relates to JRA-10793 I think...

Regards,

fields.summary: organization chart

fields.description:
A scenario which we discovered from a user's support request:

# Enable anonymous comment (Add "Anyone" to "Add Comment" and "Browse Project" permission)
# Ensure that users are added into the "Administrators" role in the project role mapping, e.g. Users: Foo, Bar; Groups: jira-administrators
# View issue without logging into JIRA and you will notice two things:
## NPE thrown and logged in the log file:
{noformat}
2007-06-22 18:33:12,937 http-8090-Processor4 ERROR [webwork.util.ServletValueStack] METHOD: "createHtml", exception: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.actor.UserRoleActorFactory$UserRoleActor.contains(UserRoleActorFactory.java:114)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.CachingProjectRoleAndActorStore$CachedDefaultRoleActors.contains(CachingProjectRoleAndActorStore.java:465)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.DefaultProjectRoleManager.getProjectRoles(DefaultProjectRoleManager.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CommentSystemField.getRoleLevels(CommentSystemField.java:515)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CommentSystemField.populateVelocityParams(CommentSystemField.java:407)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CommentSystemField.getCreateHtml(CommentSystemField.java:108)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}
## Comment fields disappeared (although the "Add Comment" container is visible)

This happens because both {{UserRoleActorFactory}} and {{GroupRoleActorFactory}} are added to the {{CachedDefaultRoleActors}} as its construction level.
fields.summary: UserRoleActorFactory is not null-safe causing weird behaviour at some point, e.g. comment box in view issue screen

fields.description:
Investigation of the performance of the AJAX issue picker as sometimes on jira.atlassian.com the responses are coming back > 3 secs at which point they get ignored.

All tests are done with 10 issues in the recent history and a current search of all issues in all projects. Tests are performed from Sydney office to remote server in US.

During a light period of load (99% cpu idle, low disk io) the following was noted:

|| Search time || Request Time ||
| 119 | 553
| 97 | 581
| 153 | 695
| 117 | 574

So, average network overhead is on the order of 400-500ms.
fields.summary: AJAX Issue Picker performance investigation
Issue Age Field

fields.description: Just noticed that the version management documentation hasn't changed in quite some time and it shows the versions in the reverse order of how they are shown nowadays.  This isn't really important, but I thought I would share in case you want to put a couple of new screenshots in there and keep some folks from scratching their heads.  As I recall, first time I managed versions I kept fighting the order it wanted to put them in because I assumed they should be in oldest first order (perhaps because of what I had seen in the docs).
fields.summary: Version Management Documentation shows versions in reverse order

fields.description:
The import wizard disrupts a well working import configuration file when trying to extend the import to more than one project.

Background explanation:

I had to split one of my projects into two projects and wanted to use the same import configuration for both projects.
There are many custom fields in our jira instance, much of them are not configured globally.
The imports are done every day for only one issue type.
Especially the imported issue type has many dedicated custom fields (fields imported from another database).
Exactly speaking: the available context is not global, but restricted to just this issue type.
Sometimes also a project restriction applies, but for the 2 imported projects exactly the same fields are configured.

Now the problem is that it is very easy to change by hand the configuration file so that both projects are imported together with the same import cfg file.
But when I try to make the same changes using the wizard to update the old cfg file, this fails, because all dedicated custom fields cannot be mapped anymore!
The file created by the wizard does not use my custom fields, but tries to create new ones.
It is even impossible to chose the dedicated (=not global) custom fields in the wizard's input mask.
This did never happen when I only had cfg files for importing single projects.
It's only a problem when importing multiple projects with one import cfg file containing the following lines:

existingprojectkey = 
importsingleproject = false
importexistingproject = true
mapfromcsv = true

As a jira application admin without direct access to the server, I would like to be able to update the import cfg files using the Wizard.
Otherwise I have to ask every time my IT responsible to upload the updated file.

Using two separate import cfg files for the 2 projects is not an option.
In fact the number of projects concerned by external data imports is increasing and since we are importing each project every day by hand I would like to keep the number of imports as low as possible. Optimal would be to import all projects with one import file.
fields.summary: CSV import wizard for multiple projects only supports global custom fields
Consider adding a SOAP service to get all groups

fields.description: In an installation that has large numbers of issue types combined with large numbers of projects, the queries to find which projects are the context of each issue type are slow. The number of queries are the product of the two variables so the slowdown is exponential. The database query is actually redundant and should be performed lazily.
fields.summary: Large numbers of Issue Types and Projects slow down the IssueNavigator edit filter form

fields.description: Not getting email notifications when tasks are assigned to me as a tester
fields.summary: Not getting email notifications when tasks are assigned to me as a tester

fields.description:
JIRA displays the installation type (JIRA Standalone or EAR/WAR)  in the System Info page.

When running the Standalone version on Windows, and installed as a service, JIRA displays "EAR / WAR". It should display "JIRA Standalone".

It does not do this when running the same instance, but from the command line instead of as a service. That is, when run from the command line, it displays "JIRA Standalone" correctly.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Incorrectly reporting Installation type as EAR/WAR instead of Standalone when running as a Windows service

fields.description:
The searching feature is not able to wildcard-search for some long English words end with with "-ation", "-lization" and other  similar combinations. This is probably due to the behaviour of the English analyzer (meaning, switching indexing method to Russian or other languages fixes the problem)

For example,
1. Create an issue with summary: Internationalization
2. Navigate to Find issues, search for issues with internation?lization

Result: No matching issues found
fields.summary: Wildcard searching does not work on long english text

fields.description:
Please allow a new kind of user-management option that disallows manual changing that directly uses the database, but still allows functions (such as user creation or password updating) that can be forwarded to external user management programs, such as Crowd.

The rationale behind this request is that Crowd integration recommends that "External User Management" is turned on, however turning this option on removes the links on JIRA for users to create accounts and/or update passwords.  These links are very useful where they're already located inside of JIRA.  It would be a frustrating experience for a user to find our JIRA instance, realize they need an account to create an issue, have to navigate elsewhere to create the account, and then return back to JIRA to create the issue.

In the absence of being able to internally forward these requests to Crowd, an alternate approach would be to supply an href to JIRA in a configuration file that would cause any user-update requests to go to that link (instead of the pre-existing JIRA page).
fields.summary: Better Crowd Integration Options
Remove the domain part of email address when autocreating users

fields.description:
This feature would allow a better integration between Jira and Confluence.
It would allow us to use JIRA as our support portal, while still point to correct project documentation per client.
fields.summary: New Portlet: List of Confluence Space I have access to

fields.description:
The "log work" time tracking interface should allow fractional durations, e.g. 1.5d, to be entered in the "Time Spent" and "Set estimated time remaining" fields.

This is especially aggravating since the interface outputs fractional times, but doesn't allow them to be entered.
fields.summary: Log work interface should accept fractional durations

fields.description:
The idea is to have the parent issue remaining effort composed of the sum of the remaining of its children.
In order to support gross estimates approach versus refined over the release cycle, the following rule should be applied as well: change the remaining of the parent issue only when the sum of the remaining for the children is higher to the current remaining at parent level.

Without this feature, it's a pain for people (mostly PM) to efficiently track the remaining effort on a given release, or to identifed which remaining effort is the most relevant.
fields.summary: Ability to sum sub-tasks remaining effort at parent issue level

fields.description:
Shouldn't Release Notes be separated as Resolved (Fixed) / Known Issues?

When using the release notes function I notice I get a list of *everything* under that version.  I get open / closed / fixed / obsolete / etc.
fields.summary: Allow to customise release notes to allow resolved issues with only certain resolutions

fields.description:
The table width of the login/logout panel doesn't grow with the width of the logo. Please look at the screenshot for more details.

A customer request:

From Christoph,
>My question refers to the kind of pages like logout, login, administrator and so on.
>If you use a company logo wider than the table width on these pages, the table width doesn't grow centered with the logo width dynamically.
>So you get an unbeautiful Screen.
fields.summary: Login Panel should be dynamic with the width of logo

fields.description:
To replicate:

 - Go to Administration -> General Configuration, and change "Indexing language" to Russian.
 - Reindex JIRA.
 - Create an issue containing "ABC1" in the description, and another containing "ABC2".
 - Search for "ABC1". Both issues (the ABC2 one included) will show up.

This problem does not affect English, German or cjk index languages.
fields.summary: Russian indexing language causes some searches to return irrelevant results

fields.description:
Going to Administration -> {project}, click "View Members" of project roles, and click on "Edit" in the Groups column. Here it wants groups, but if you enter a username it accepts that too:

!projectrolemembers.png!

(here 'bob' is a user, not a group)

This doesn't seem to result in stacktraces or errors.
fields.summary: Users can be added in the Groups section when editing role memberships

fields.description:
Whenever I switch between screen tabs in the Issue Summary screen Firefox crashes. It will happen after switching between the tabs 4 or 5 times and I can reproduce the behaviour every time.
I don't get this problem on Internet Explorer so I think it may be just be a Firefox issue perhaps???

Anyone else getting this issue?

NOTE: Don't get this confused with the "FireFox" tabs. I am NOT referring to those, but the JIRA screen tabs that you can create for screens in JIRA.
fields.summary: Switching between JIRA Screen Tabs causes Firefox to crash

fields.description:
Pai chart (Report and Charting plugin) does not show no of issues and % of issues. This is displayed on mouse-over of the pai chart. It should also displayed in the text mode.

Thanks - Mohan
fields.summary: Pai chart does not show no of issues and % of issues

fields.description: Previously, Mantis importer set versions based on Status, even though it did have an explicit Fix for version.
fields.summary: Import and set correct fix for versions in Mantis

When importing from Mantis, and there was a null comment, a NullPointer was thrown.

fields.description:
Notification emails render poorly with a number of ugly gaps in them in Outlook 2007.

While the workaround is obvious, there are too many horses and not all of them will drink anyway.
fields.summary: HTML issue event notification emails render poorly in Outlook 2007

fields.description:
When a group is subscribed to the filter, and then that group is deleted, the filtersubscription still exists, and once a minute the logs get filled with these errors:

2007-06-18 12:46:04,585 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem subject: 'Subscription: testfilter' Owner: 'test ERROR [atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl] Error occurred in sending e-mail: com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem subject: 'Subscription: testfilter' Owner: 'test
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: com.opensymphony.user.EntityNotFoundException: No group testgroup found
    at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:88)
    at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:68)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
    at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
    at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
Caused by: com.opensymphony.user.EntityNotFoundException: No group testgroup found
    at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getEntity(UserManager.java:302)
    at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getGroup(UserManager.java:172)
    at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:71)
    ... 6 more
2007-06-18 12:46:04,585 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem subject: 'Subscription: testfilter' Owner: 'test ERROR [atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem] com.opensymphony.user.EntityNotFoundException: No group testgroup found
com.opensymphony.user.EntityNotFoundException: No group testgroup found
    at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getEntity(UserManager.java:302)
    at com.opensymphony.user.UserManager.getGroup(UserManager.java:172)
    at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:71)
    at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:68)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
    at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
    at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
    at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)


Assuming that this is not an error condition (that it's okay to have dangling group pointers in filtersubscriptions), we should a) log it as WARN, not ERROR, b) print a one-line message, rather than a stacktrace.
fields.summary: Verbose logging when filter subscription sends to nonexistent group

fields.description:
On the "Share Current Filter" page (/secure/ShareFilter!default.jspa):

!sharefilter.png!

If a group is selected from the "Share with group" drop-down, one would expect the "Share with group" radio list button to be selected automatically. It isn't, and so the group you've selected isn't used.
fields.summary: UI bug: Choosing "Share with group" select list option does not auto-select the radio button

fields.description: From JIRAs dashboard when you run out of the box "Watches" filter, it displays all Watches Issues, however it does not provide the functionality export to excel. This will be very useful.
fields.summary: Ability to export Watched Issues to excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12920].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

I am thinking of having a field that serves as an time estimator field. That means, that the assignee can specify in days or weeks estimate of period they need to complete an assignment. 

Unfortunately I don't find one in the JIRA custom fields section. 

Any ideas for this? Or is there any alternative to this?
fields.summary: Convert Date Picker to A Time Tracker
Provide a way to bulk print issues
When performing a worflow transition on an issue operation it would be great to be able to see previous comments or the previous screen in general

fields.description:
See forum post [here|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=18183]:

Basically The help text should read "Move issues between projects _or between workflows of the same project_".
fields.summary: Improve on-line documentation on move permission
Can't use Firefox 3.0a5 to create bugs in Jira

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using MindManager to create issues and maintain our backlog of tasks.  We then create the issues in Jira by exporting the mindmap to MS Project, export the MS Project file to XML and import the XML into Jira with Jimex.  This works but it is a bit cumbersome and we would like Jira to read the MindManager export directly.

Thanks,

Bjarni
fields.summary: MindManager import (similar to Jimex)
Allow for adding entire JIRA groups to a watch list

fields.description: The {{validateCommentUpdate()}}, {{hasPermissionToUpdate()}} and {{hasPermissionToDelete()}} methods on {{DefaultCommentService}} check the user's comment-related permissions but neglect to check whether they have a role/group security level viewable by the user attempting to delete a comment.
fields.summary: CommentService validation methods do not check user's security level

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
  1. suppose you have a project called "FOO"
  2. create an issue within the "FOO" project ; this issue is auto-assigned a key/ID
  3. let's agree this issue is assigned "FOO-100"
  4. now Move FOO-100, but only change the issue-type  (don't change it's project)
  5. for example, move it from issue-type "Bug" to "Improvement"
  6. now, create a second issue within the "FOO" project

RESULT:
   - the second issue is auto-assigned a key/ID of "FOO-102"

EXPECTED RESULT:
   - the second issue is auto-assigned a key/ID which is exactly [ the last issue key in the project + 1]
   - in our case, we would expect the second issue to be assigned a key of "FOO-101"

WHY I EXPECT THIS:
   - It can be very confusing for users to see a gap like this
   - We often move issues within the same project, changing only the issue-type ; this results in many "gaps"

ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:
   - Obviously, I do not know the JIRA data-base architecture at all (all I know is that mysql is used)
   - However, if the issue-type is only a property of the issue (basically, a property of the object), why create a "null" entry in the db (the "gap" number) when an issue is moved?  I assume this "null" entry is used as some kind of pointer...

   - I apologize if this issue or a near-duplicate issue already exists within the JIRA public issue data-base.  I queried the data-base a lot, but did not find a seemingly duplicate issue...
fields.summary: moving an issue [ creates +1 gap / skips a number ] in the project auto-numbering sequence

fields.description:
If a user logs out of JIRA in one browser window and then attempts to perform an issue operation in another, the user is not sent to the login page.

The page simply sends the request in the background and does not process the not logged in response correctly.

I came across this issue when I deleted all my cookies recently and then tried to comment on an issue on jira.atlassian.com
fields.summary: AJAX issue operations hide logout.

fields.description:
I edited a comment on support.atlassian.com, but the notification email I received had two errors:

- the from address used the original author's name
- the body of the email said:

"Peter Raymond edited comment on CSP-8619 at 6/13/07 7:59 PM:"

In fact, it was me who edited the comment.
fields.summary: Notification email incorrectly attributes comment edits to original author

fields.description:
Maybe wrap this page into the main page?
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/mysql-configuration-guide.html
fields.summary: improve the MySQL setup documentation

fields.description: I'm not sure if this exists (like you just need to change a configuration or something), but it would be very useful to have, in the ticket history, what specific email addresses were emailed when a notification event occurs.
fields.summary: Record who was emailed when an update occurred

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12901].
  {panel}

A support customer is bringing emails into JIRA using the POP service. An email that contains "inline" XML (i.e. XML as the body of the message, not as an attachment) and with MIME type text/xml, results in an empty JIRA issue being created. That is, the XML is not in the issue, neither as the description nor as an attachment. The XML data is lost.

Furthermore, there is information produced in the log.

The support case is [JSP-12868|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12868].

The customer's email is sent by Microsoft Biztalk. I managed to reproduce the problem, sending the email using Mutt (and super-Jeff). I have attached the mail Jeff and I used to reproduce the problem.

If the email instead has the XML as an attachment (not inline), and the attachment is of type text/xml, then the XML is included in the created issue (as an attachment).

If the XML is in the body of the message, but the message type is text/plain, the XML is included in the created issue (in the description).

That is, the problem only exists for inline XML with mail type text/xml.

Kind regards,
Ian
fields.summary: Email of MIME type text/xml sent to JIRA results in empty issue

fields.description:
Safari Version 2.0.4 (419.3) and Opera Version 9.21 wont expand the Y scroll bar if an autocomplete (such as for the new Ajax User Picker dropdown) drops past the bottom of the screen.   Essentially this means that entries beyond the window border cant be selected/seen by the user.  The workaround is to use the 'old' user picker by clicking on the user icon next to the text field or upgrading to a real browser such as [Firefox|http://www.getfirefox.com].

Note that this seems to have been fixed in Safari Version 3.0 (522.11.3).
fields.summary: Safari and Opera wont expand scroll bar for autocomplete dropdown

fields.description: The fixVersions parameter is not working in the CreateIssue jelly tag. However this bug is fixed in 3.6.1
fields.summary: FixVersions parameter is being ignored in the CreateIssue tag

fields.description:
In the following Jelly, the version 3.0 will be missing from the cerated issue.  Ordering matters here starting from left to right.  Also fixVersions is also broken.  Possibly components as well as reported by the customer

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">

<jira:CreateIssue
project-key="TP"
summary="My test summary"
priority="Minor"
versions="4.0,1.0,2.0,3.0"
fixVersions="4.0,1.0,2.0,3.0"
assignee="test"
reporter="test"
description="My test Description"
duedate="2006-05-12 00:00:00"
created="2006-05-12 13:03:33"
updated="2006-07-11 22:40:06"
duplicateSummary="ignore"
/>

</JiraJelly>
{code}
fields.summary: Jelly createIssue tag does not set more than 3 versions

fields.description:
Create a guide on "How to get started quickly in JIRA", aimed at end-users who are project managers etc. Scenario: Your organisation has installed JIRA and told you that you need to use it. What do you need to do, as minimum, to get your team up and running.

Requirement for this guide was raised by a client and discussed in a webex session hosted by Joshua Wold on Wed 6 June 2007. Josh remarked that many other clients had asked for such a guide.

Discuss requirements with Josh.
fields.summary: Guide on "How to get started quickly in JIRA"

However, Dashboard has "Applications" Portlet which does not seem to be using strings from the jarfile. I will attach screenshot as well.
fields.summary: Applications Portlet Does Not use Resource Bundle for Display "Lead" text
New permissions item - version maintenance (v3)

fields.description:
Stylesheet is broken for RSS view. This is because the {{jirarss2html.xsl}} is outdated, i.e. there's no template for the different tags:

* description
* author
* etc..

Perhaps we should use new /different stylesheets for searchrequest-rss-header.vm.
fields.summary: XSL Stylesheet broken for RSS view

fields.description:
Images in XSL Stylesheet  are broken due to incorrect XPath *{{../../link}}*:

{code:xml}
<?xml-stylesheet href="http://localhost:8990/styles/jirarss2html.xsl" type="text/xsl"?>
<rss version="0.92" >
<channel>
    <title>Your Company JIRA</title>
    <link>http://localhost:8990/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10001&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC</link>
    <description>An XML representation of a search request</description>

    <language>en</language>
<item>
<title>[TPJ-1] Test Issue</title>
<link>http://localhost:8990/browse/TPJ-1</link>

                    <description></description>
                <environment></environment>
            <key id="10000">TPJ-1</key>
        <summary>Test Issue</summary>

        <type id="1">Bug</type>
{code}

This gives you *{{/rss/channel/title/link}}* instead.
fields.summary: Images in XSL Stylesheet are broken

fields.description:
Given a CSV file containing: type,summary,customfield+ Bug, "Hooray", TestValue If this is fed into the CSV mapping wizard, it breaks on step 2 of 5 (ConfigureCsvMapping.jspa) with a big uninformative error in the browser: HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [ConfigureCsvMapping]:null

webwork.action.ResultException at webwork.action.factory.ParametersActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ParametersActionFactoryProxy.java:55) at webwork.action.factory.ChainingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ChainingActionFactoryProxy.java:52) at webwork.action.factory.DefaultActionFactory.getActionImpl(DefaultActionFactory.java:125) at webwork.action.factory.ActionFactory.getAction(ActionFactory.java:63) at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:120) at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:209) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:252) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173) at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.AccessLogFilter.doFilter(AccessLogFilter.java:73) at
...

and a more informative error in the logs:

2007-06-12 11:21:22,926 http-8080-Processor23 WARN [webwork.util.BeanUtil] Could not set parameter "field.customfield+" with value "[Ljava.lang.String;@14005e1" on class class com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.csv.ConfigureCsvMapping:java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
    at webwork.util.Query.(Query.java:67)
    at webwork.util.Query.getQuery(Query.java:34)
    at webwork.util.Query.(Query.java:136)
    at webwork.util.Query.getQuery(Query.java:34)
    at webwork.util.BeanUtil.setProperty(BeanUtil.java:239)
    at webwork.util.BeanUtil.setProperties(BeanUtil.java:182)
    at webwork.action.factory.ParametersActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ParametersActionFactoryProxy.java:53)
    at webwork.action.factory.ChainingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ChainingActionFactoryProxy.java:52)
    at webwork.action.factory.DefaultActionFactory.getActionImpl(DefaultActionFactory.java:125)
    at webwork.action.factory.ActionFactory.getAction(ActionFactory.java:63)
    at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:120)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:209)


It seems we're not escaping something from Webwork.
fields.summary: CSV importer wizard breaks when custom field name contains a plus

fields.description:
When a (custom) validator is placed on the "Create Issue" transition, and the validator fails, the error message:
 - Is placed at the top of the screen, rather than associating with any field.
 - Contains the name of the exception class (com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException, for instance), which is confusing and irrelevant to end users.

We should clean up this error handling, particularly involving WorkflowExceptions, which validators throw.
fields.summary: Ugly reporting of failing validators on Create Issue

fields.description:
It would be great if when viewing the results of a filter, you could easily add the Filter Issues portlet to your dashboard for that filter.

At the moment, the 'Charts' link lets you do this for charts. I'd find it handy to do this with just a list of issues as well.
fields.summary: "Add to dashboard" link for filter in issue navigator

fields.description:
Really trivial issue, I know, but when I was showing someone how to use the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Portlet, the helptext for  Show Totals reads "Whether to show totals for each of the columns", when in fact it shows totals for columns _and_ rows, which is what I wanted, but I wasn't sure it was going to do that until I said Yes. So this issue is just to fix up that help text on the add/edit portlet screen.

Cheers
fields.summary: Documentation of 2D portlet misleading
create new issue from comment

fields.description:
I have two projects, projectA and projectB. Issue security for projectA is fairly open, but projectB is fairly closed. If I have issues in both projects and I link an issue in projectA to an issue in projectB, JIRA behaves correctly in that a user viewing the issue in projectA does not see the link to the issue in projectB in the links section. That's good.

However, if the user in projectA clicks on the "ALL" tab, there is an entry that shows the link to the issue in projectB. That's not so good.
fields.summary: Links to issues in secured projects are visible in the ALL tab

fields.description: It would be useful to restrict who is able to delete what issue type.
fields.summary: Finer grained delete permissions

fields.description:
Hello,

When we have to create a new user with a lot of project with the new functionnality of role, it is very difficult to ad him to each project because we have to add project one by one, then we can choose the role for each project. When we used groups, we could select several groups with <Ctrl><Select> and this was easier.
fields.summary: Adding user on role on several projects is very difficult

fields.description:
This issue only started when we upgraded from 3.1 to 3.7.4

Issues commented throught the CVS Log Handler are not sending notification emails any users. If the issue is commented by hand (through JIRA) users do get a notification (so there is no problem with notification or email setup).

It looks therefore that this feature was broken sometime between 3.1 and 3.7.4
fields.summary: CVS Log Handler no longer generates Issue Commented notifications
Customfield User Picker "corrupted" after a user is deleted
Old CVS module properties not removed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Go to *Admin* -- *Global Settings* -- *CVS Modules*.
* Set up a repository with a *Log File Path* to be _path_1_. Let the service retrieve the CVS commits and store them in the file at that location.
* Change the *Log File Path* to be _path_2_ and see that the CVS service will create a new file at _path_2_ but *not delete the old file at _path_1_*.

The fix would be to detect if the *Log File Path* changed and if so delete the old file.
fields.summary: Log file left behind after its path changed in the CVS Module

fields.description: When trying to grant the permission/notification for the Group/Multi Group picker, the select list and multi-select list customfields appear in the option of Group Custom Field Value. Is this the intended behavior?
fields.summary: Select List and Multi-select List appear in the Group Custom Field Value (Permission/Notification scheme)
Trivial UI bug

fields.description:
There are a number of malformed properties in the default locale JiraWebActionSupport.properties and corresponding problems in the files for other locales.

We need to do a systematic search and fix for the following circumstances:

* no equals sign between property key and value
* incorrect line continuations: the backslash "\" at the end of the line should accompany a value continued on the next line, not a new key=value pair.
* incomplete/half written keys with no value
* <webwork:property> tags in values! e.g. {{admin.workflows.delete.confirmation}}
* duplicate keys
fields.summary: Malformed Ressource Bundle properties files

fields.description:
Sorry for the crap summary but here's how to reproduce

# Go to SAC
# Do a quick search "BSP Unresolved"
# Click on Charts
# Save a new filter
# Click on Configure.

The configure page opens without any decorators
fields.summary: The auto charting function sometimes does strange things...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12861].
  {panel}

Requested by a user:

> Now, I have to select each user for adding the couple property (key-value)

> Thanks
> regards
> claudehenri
fields.summary: Bulk add/edit custom user properties

fields.description: The components selection box on the create new issue screen is too small when you have a large number of components.  It would be better to have some kind of larger popup with checkboxes next to each component for multiple selections
fields.summary: Expand Components selection box on create new issue screen

fields.description:
In JRA-2276 it was mentioned that listeners should have an order.  I have a need for this one particular part of that request.  Here is my scenario:
- I have custom user fields for key people for a component (more than lead) who I want to send notifications to.
- I have a listener which populates these custom fields when the issue is added
- I have changed the notifications to include these custom fields

The problem now is that the order appears to be random so there is no guarantee that my listener goes before the mail listener.

Having the ability to order the listeners would be helpful in this and it seems like in general people may want to ensure an order and not have it random.
fields.summary: Allow listeners to have an order set to them

fields.description: As you can see in the attached screenshot, even on the most recent version of JIRA, when the Issue links link is clicked and you are on the manage links page, the linked issue does not display with strikethrough even though the issue is resolved. This would seem to be inconsistent with JIRA's philosophy of showing resolved issues in strikethrough font.
fields.summary: Resolved issue not showing with strikethrough on Manage links page

fields.description:
Some customers would like to be able to delete the history of an attachment on an issue, so that only the latest version is available. Another alternative is to delete all versions older than the 10 last versions, so we aren't storing the complete file history for all attachments.

[mail.unomaha.edu]
fields.summary: Add ability to delete attachment history
Login Redirect URL loses Issue ID

fields.description:
In the class {{CustomFieldSearcherModuleDescriptor.java}} there are 2 get*HTML methods that do not inject the CustomFields velocity params.  They are - {{getViewHTML}} and {{getStatHTML}}

I can't see any real reason not to inject these.
fields.summary: CustomFieldSearcherModuleDescriptor does not inject velocity params in all get*Html methods
List boxes on the "Create New Issue" form are annoying tiny peepholes into a large list of items.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12847].
  {panel}

Currently we have both French and English people accessing the system. We don't make it mandatory for people to log in as everything is viewable. The problem is obvious here: English users see a French  page when they aren't logged in (French is the default).

It would be nice to offer a link somewhere on the screen to change languages (for the session only).

Even better would be to detect the browser locale and load with that locale if possible (the links to change manually would stay).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Users not logged in should be able to change locale

fields.description:
We need the ability to restrict searches to under a fixed number of results. This is so a server is not stressed by serving search results that are often too large to be useful.

This affects all the issue view links on the Issue Navigator.

This feature needs to be able to be overridden if a user is in a particular group.
fields.summary: Ability to limit the number of results in a Search Request
